dict.acceptation: 恐怖；恐怖的缘由；恐怖行为；令人讨厌的人；

sent.orig: A cry of terror arose. The whole multitude prostrated themselves, terror-stricken, on the ground.
sent.trans: 人群发出了恐怖的喊声，他们一个个都吓得魂不附体，跪在地上了。

sent.orig: Disappointment is much preferable to stark terror, and terror was what I stumbled into that night.
sent.trans: 令人失望总比令人恐惧要好，而那天晚上我所邂逅的场景，着实令人毛骨悚然。

sent.orig: If Jabez Stone had been sick with terror before, he was blind with terror now.
sent.trans: 要是杰贝兹·史东原先已吓破了胆的话，那他现在便是魂不附体了。

sent.orig: The nexus of poisons and terror is new. The nexus of Iraq and terror is old.
sent.trans: 毒剂与恐怖的联系是个新的方式，但伊拉克与恐怖的联系有长久的历史。

sent.orig: Her tongue was swollen with terror.
sent.trans: 她吓得结结巴巴，做声不得。
